newsitem.title: UK: Wagon down on lower H1 profit figures.
newsitem.headline: Wagon down on lower H1 profit figures.

text.p: Shares in Wagon Industrial Holdings Plc tumbled to a new year's low on Wednesday as the storage products and retail systems manufacturer announced lower interim pre-tax profits.
The shares dropped as low as 291p, before paring losses to trade at 295p by 1129 GMT, down 21-1/2p on the day.

The company's pretax profit for the six months ended September 30 dropped to 11.6 million stg from 13.4 million stg in the same period last year because of production scheduling changes which affected manufacturing efficiency.
Chairman Paul Taylor said in a statement accompanying the results the company expected second half results to improve.

"Demand levels in storage products and precision engineering continue to be reasonable..Our overall expectation is that the group's underlying result should be similar to the comparable period last year," he added.
Taylor attributed the scheduling changes to the major food retailers deferring decisions on store refurbishment programmes.
